alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:27PM EST until January 11 at 3:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following creeks in Pennsylvania... Sherman Creek at Shermans Dale affecting Perry County. Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties. Swatara Creek near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. For the Sherman Creek...including Shermans Dale...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern and Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek near Hershey. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:01 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The creek is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 7.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
